snippet: A lawsuit charges that Starbucks employees at two Manhattan stores refused to take deaf customers’ orders, stared when they signed to each other and, in one case, mocked them.
abstract: Group of Starbucks patrons, most of them deaf, file lawsuit against the coffee chain alleging that they were discriminated against by workers at two of its Manhattan stores; legal battle has jolted many New Yorkers who have made the ubiquitous coffee shops part of their routine, and serves as a reminder that intolerance can be all too common for some populations.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit charges that Starbucks employees at two Manhattan stores refused to take deaf customers’ orders, stared when they signed to each other and, in one case, mocked them.

headline.main: Deaf Patrons’ Suit Accuses Starbucks of Discrimination
headline.print_headline: Deaf Patrons’ Suit Accuses Starbucks of Discrimination
